name: dissidence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of publicly disagreeing with and criticizing the government or a powerful person or group: Dissidence has been met with steady opposition. There is a growing youth dissidence movement. See
dissident
More examplesFewer examplesMusic has often been seen as a galvanizing form of dissidence.This latest move provoked dissidence even among some of his most loyal supporters.Hers was a strong voice of dissidence toward the bureaucracy.
